intro: Rosa canina f. hispidelloides, commonly known as the hispidelloides rose, is a botanical variant of the dog rose. It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and thorny stems, which are typical features of the Rosa genus. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. Its fruits, known as hips, are orange-red and contain a high concentration of vitamin C. This form is often cultivated for its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine.
